turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I need you to order me a coffee so I don't have to wait for it.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Where are you at? I mean which store are you wanting to pick it up from.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: The Starbucks at Roswell and E.Piedmont.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: You got it. What are you drinking?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Large Americano made with French Roast with two fingers of room at the top. Double cupped.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Okay. So you want a large Americano with two fingers from the Starbucks on Roswell at East Piedmont?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: When do you want to pick it up.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Ten minutes.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: I'll give them a call and make sure they have it waiting for you.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Thanks. You're the best.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Do you want one of those Cranberry cookies that you like as well?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Now I do.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said anything.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Nah. You're good. I'd have been mad at myself for not ordering the cookie and probably gotten one anyway.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: So add a cookie.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Make it two cookies.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Two cookies it is.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Good looking out on the cookies. Talk to you later.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: You're welcome.
